The Twelve Earthly Branches and Zodiac Animals

Explore the Twelve Earthly Branches (ì§€ì§€) and their connection to the Korean zodiac animals. Learn their meanings, hours, and relationships.

By Saju Guide Team â€¢ January 4, 2024 â€¢ 13 min read

Understanding Earthly Branches

The Twelve Earthly Branches (ì§€ì§€/åœ°æ”¯, Jiji) represent the terrestrial counterpart to the Heavenly Stems. While stems represent celestial qi, branches represent how that energy manifests on Earth. Each branch is associated with an animal, a two-hour period of the day, a month, and specific elemental qualities.

In Korean culture, most people know their birth yearâ€™s zodiac animal from the Twelve Branchesâ€”but in Saju, branches appear in all four pillars, providing much richer information.

Understanding Each Branch

å­ (Ja) - Rat ğŸ€

Element: Water | Season: Mid-Winter | Hours: 23:00-01:00

The Rat opens the cycle, representing new beginnings in the darkest hour. Despite its small size, the rat is clever, resourceful, and survives where others cannot.

Characteristics:

  • Quick-witted and intelligent
  • Resourceful problem-solver
  • Charming and sociable
  • Adaptable to circumstances
  • Good with finances and resources

Years: 2020, 2008, 1996, 1984, 1972, 1960â€¦

ä¸‘ (Chuk) - Ox ğŸ‚

Element: Earth | Season: Late Winter | Hours: 01:00-03:00

The Ox represents steadfast labor and patient progress. It doesnâ€™t seek glory but accomplishes its tasks with unwavering determination.

Characteristics:

  • Hardworking and diligent
  • Patient and methodical
  • Honest and dependable
  • Strong and resilient
  • Conservative and traditional

Years: 2021, 2009, 1997, 1985, 1973, 1961â€¦

å¯… (In) - Tiger ğŸ…

Element: Wood | Season: Early Spring | Hours: 03:00-05:00

The Tiger marks springâ€™s arrival with powerful, assertive energy. Bold and confident, the tiger commands respect through presence alone.

Characteristics:

  • Brave and confident
  • Natural leader
  • Competitive and ambitious
  • Protective of loved ones
  • Can be unpredictable

Years: 2022, 2010, 1998, 1986, 1974, 1962â€¦

å¯ (Myo) - Rabbit ğŸ‡

Element: Wood | Season: Spring | Hours: 05:00-07:00

The Rabbit moves through life with grace and awareness. Where the Tigerâ€™s Wood is forceful, the Rabbitâ€™s is gentle and diplomatic.

Characteristics:

  • Gentle and peace-loving
  • Artistic and refined
  • Quick and alert
  • Diplomatic in conflicts
  • Needs security and comfort

Years: 2023, 2011, 1999, 1987, 1975, 1963â€¦

è¾° (Jin) - Dragon ğŸ‰

Element: Earth | Season: Late Spring | Hours: 07:00-09:00

The Dragon is the only mythical creature in the cycle, representing extraordinary potential and good fortune. In Korean culture, Dragon years are considered especially auspicious.

Characteristics:

  • Powerful and ambitious
  • Charismatic and magnetic
  • Confident and enthusiastic
  • Visionary and innovative
  • Prone to perfectionism

Years: 2024, 2012, 2000, 1988, 1976, 1964â€¦

å·³ (Sa) - Snake ğŸ

Element: Fire | Season: Early Summer | Hours: 09:00-11:00

The Snake moves with purpose and wisdom. Often misunderstood, it possesses deep intuition and strategic intelligence.

Characteristics:

  • Wise and intuitive
  • Graceful and charming
  • Strategic thinker
  • Determined and focused
  • Private and mysterious

Years: 2025, 2013, 2001, 1989, 1977, 1965â€¦

åˆ (O) - Horse ğŸ´

Element: Fire | Season: Summer | Hours: 11:00-13:00

The Horse embodies peak Fire energyâ€”active, passionate, and free-spirited. Horses need room to run and cannot be contained.

Characteristics:

  • Energetic and active
  • Independent and free
  • Passionate and warm
  • Popular and social
  • Sometimes impatient

Years: 2026, 2014, 2002, 1990, 1978, 1966â€¦

æœª (Mi) - Goat ğŸ

Element: Earth | Season: Late Summer | Hours: 13:00-15:00

The Goat (or Sheep) represents gentleness and artistic sensitivity. It prefers harmony and beauty to competition and conflict.

Characteristics:

  • Creative and artistic
  • Gentle and kind
  • Peace-loving
  • Intuitive about othersâ€™ feelings
  • Needs support and encouragement

Years: 2027, 2015, 2003, 1991, 1979, 1967â€¦

ç”³ (Sin) - Monkey ğŸ’

Element: Metal | Season: Early Autumn | Hours: 15:00-17:00

The Monkey is endlessly clever and curious. It finds creative solutions and entertains everyone with its wit and ingenuity.

Characteristics:

  • Extremely clever
  • Curious and playful
  • Versatile and adaptable
  • Problem-solver
  • Can be mischievous

Years: 2028, 2016, 2004, 1992, 1980, 1968â€¦

é…‰ (Yu) - Rooster ğŸ“

Element: Metal | Season: Autumn | Hours: 17:00-19:00

The Rooster announces each day with precision and confidence. It takes pride in appearance and performance.

Characteristics:

  • Confident and proud
  • Hardworking and observant
  • Honest and direct
  • Detail-oriented
  • Perfectionist tendencies

Years: 2029, 2017, 2005, 1993, 1981, 1969â€¦

æˆŒ (Sul) - Dog ğŸ•

Element: Earth | Season: Late Autumn | Hours: 19:00-21:00

The Dog is humanityâ€™s loyal companionâ€”faithful, protective, and true. It values justice and will defend those under its care.

Characteristics:

  • Loyal and faithful
  • Honest and just
  • Protective and caring
  • Can be anxious or worried
  • Needs to feel trusted

Years: 2030, 2018, 2006, 1994, 1982, 1970â€¦

äº¥ (Hae) - Pig ğŸ·

Element: Water | Season: Early Winter | Hours: 21:00-23:00

The Pig closes the cycle with generosity and good cheer. It enjoys lifeâ€™s pleasures and shares abundance with others.

Characteristics:

  • Generous and giving
  • Sincere and honest
  • Patient and tolerant
  • Enjoys the good life
  • Can be too trusting

Years: 2031, 2019, 2007, 1995, 1983, 1971â€¦

Branch Relationships

Six Harmonies (ìœ¡í•©/å…­åˆ)

Certain pairs of branches have natural harmony:

PairAnimalsBond Type
å­-ä¸‘Rat-OxEarth harmony
å¯…-äº¥Tiger-PigWood harmony
å¯-æˆŒRabbit-DogFire harmony
è¾°-é…‰Dragon-RoosterMetal harmony
å·³-ç”³Snake-MonkeyWater harmony
åˆ-æœªHorse-GoatSun/Moon harmony

Six Clashes (ìœ¡ì¶©/å…­æ²–)

Opposite pairs create tension:

PairAnimalsConflict Type
å­-åˆRat-HorseWater vs Fire
ä¸‘-æœªOx-GoatEarth conflict
å¯…-ç”³Tiger-MonkeyWood vs Metal
å¯-é…‰Rabbit-RoosterWood vs Metal
è¾°-æˆŒDragon-DogEarth conflict
å·³-äº¥Snake-PigFire vs Water

Three Harmonies (ì‚¼í•©/ä¸‰åˆ)

Groups of three branches that form elemental alliances:

  • Wood Frame: Tiger-Horse-Dog (å¯…åˆæˆŒ)
  • Fire Frame: Snake-Rooster-Ox (å·³é…‰ä¸‘)
  • Metal Frame: Monkey-Rat-Dragon (ç”³å­è¾°)
  • Water Frame: Pig-Rabbit-Goat (äº¥å¯æœª)

Beyond the Year Animal

Remember: your zodiac animal from your birth year is just one of potentially four branch animals in your chart. Your Day Branch animal, in particular, reveals more personal characteristics than the Year Branch, which relates more to your public persona and family background.
